channel.title: Disappeared message help

item.title: Disappeared message help
item.dc:creator: @RSPS222 RSPS222
item.description:
@RSPS222 wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:6, topic:481608”]public void sendTimeMessage() { String message = "Time message"; EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { sendMessage(message); } }, 5000); };
thank you but i want to under stand the code thank you.
It will send the message every 5 seconds. Just call it where ever you need to.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Disappeared message help
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

Js, saying “call it wherever you need to” is a little vague if you don’t know what you’re doing.

Like, i’m not saying do this, but you could use one of the redundant packets such as 226 which is an anti-cheat packet.

Read full topic

item.title: Disappeared message help
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

public void sendTimeMessage() { String message = "Time message"; EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { sendMessage(message); } }, 5000); };
It will send the message every 5 seconds. Just call it where ever you need to.

Read full topic

item.title: Disappeared message help
item.dc:creator: @RSPS222 RSPS222
item.description:
@RSPS222 wrote:

How can i make a message on the screen that disappeared after few seconds thats what i want something like this (i maked this) :

String Message = "Time message";
if(System.currentTimeMillis() == 5000){
sendMessage(Message);
}

Read full topic
